result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany A Tipton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED 08/13/15 **Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program after completing the first 3 years of her sentence.  Sentence Credit for 41 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid (jointly and severally liable with Scott L. from 14CF1058) to Jerry N. as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

Follow through with AODA treatment.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

No contact with Scott LaPorte.  No contact with Jesse LaPorte except for the limited purpose of co-parenting their child.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Brittany A Tipton in court with attorney Kevin G Keane.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Statements of victim's mother and father read into the record by the Victim Witness Specialist.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by T.T. read into the record by Attorney Keane.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 10 years (Initial Confinement: 5 years, Extended Supervision: 5 years). Credit for 41 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after completing the first 3 years of her sentence.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Restitution in the amount of $8,142.89 to be paid (jointly and severally liable with Scott L from 14CF1058) to Jerry N. as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with Scott LaPorte.  No contact with Jesse LaPorte except for the limited purpose of coparenting their child.  Follow through with AODA treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
Independent presentence report, filed by Jacqueline Schmidt
